text:
Stephanie Grisham (born 1977) is an American White House official. She was the 30th White House Press Secretary assuming office on July 1, 2019 and left office on April 7, 2020. During her tenure as Press Secretary she did not hold a briefing. Before becoming President Donald Trump's press secretary, she was the press secretary of First Lady Melania Trump from March 27, 2017 through July 1, 2019.
She was a member of Donald Trump's presidential transition team.
Grisham resigned on April 7, 2020 and became Chief of Staff to the First Lady Melania Trump.
On January 6, 2021, Grisham resigned from her position as Melania Trump's Chief of Staff following the protests on Capitol Hill.
